column2: Rayonier Advanced Materials, Inc. engages in the production and sale of cellulose products, which is a natural polymer commonly used in the production of cell phone and computer screens, filters, and pharmaceuticals. The company is headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida and currently employs 4,200 full-time employees. The firm's product lines include cellulose specialties and commodity products. Its products are used in manufacturing processes. The firm's products are sold throughout the world to companies for use in various industrial applications, and to produce a range of products, including cigarette filters, foods, pharmaceuticals, textiles and electronics. The firm focuses on producing various forms of cellulose specialties products, such as cellulose acetate and cellulose ethers. The firm's production facilities are located in Jesup, Georgia and Fernandina Beach, Florida. The Jesup plant can produce cellulose specialties or commodity products using both hardwood and softwood in a pre-hydrolyzed kraft or high potential of hydrogen (pH) cooking process. The Fernandina Beach plant can produce cellulose specialties or commodity products using softwood in a sulfite or low pH cooking process.
